content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or emotions, but I can provide some insights into the Canadiens' chances of making it to the playoffs based on their new acquisitions.

In general, adding skilled players to a team's roster can improve their chances of making it to the playoffs. The Canadiens have made some notable acquisitions for the 2021-2022 NHL season, including players like Mike Hoffman and Christian Dvorak, who could help bolster their offense. However, the team will still need to compete against other strong teams in their conference, so it's difficult to make any guarantees about their playoff chances.

That being said, the Canadiens made it to the Stanley Cup Final in the 2020-2021 NHL season, so they have already demonstrated they can compete at a high level. If they can carry over some of that success into the upcoming season and integrate their new acquisitions effectively, they certainly have a strong chance of making it to the playoffs once again.
